verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> the things whereof <S%G3739><s%> ye wrote <S%G1125><s%> unto me: <S%G3427><s%> It is good <S%G2570><s%> for a man <S%G444><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> to touch <S%G680><s%> a woman. <S%G1135><s%>

Nevertheless, <S%G1161><s%> to avoid <S%G1223><s%> fornication, <S%G4202><s%> let every man <S%G1538><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> his own <S%G1438><s%> wife, <S%G1135><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> let every woman <S%G1538><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> her own <S%G2398><s%> husband. <S%G435><s%>

Let the <S%G3588><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> render <S%G591><s%> unto the <S%G3588><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%> due <S%G3784><s%> benevolence: <S%G2133><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%> unto the <S%G3588><s%> husband. <S%G435><s%>

The <S%G3588><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%> hath not power <S%G1850><s%> <S%G3756><s%> of her own <S%G2398><s%> body, <S%G4983><s%> but <S%G235><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> husband: <S%G435><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> hath not power <S%G1850><s%> <S%G3756><s%> of his own <S%G2398><s%> body, <S%G4983><s%> but <S%G235><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> wife. <S%G1135><s%>

Defraud <S%G650><s%> ye not <S%G3361><s%> one the other, <S%G240><s%> except <S%G1509><s%> <S%G302><s%> it be with <S%G1537><s%> consent <S%G4859><s%> for <S%G4314><s%> a time, <S%G2540><s%> that <S%G2443><s%> ye may give yourselves <S%G4980><s%> to fasting <S%G3521><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> prayer; <S%G4335><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> come together <S%G4905><s%> again, <S%G3825><s%> that <S%G2443><s%> Satan <S%G4567><s%> tempt <S%G3985><s%> you <S%G5209><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> for <S%G1223><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> incontinency. <S%G192><s%>
But <S%G1161><s%> I speak <S%G3004><s%> this <S%G5124><s%> by <S%G2596><s%> permission, <S%G4774><s%> and not <S%G3756><s%> of <S%G2596><s%> commandment. <S%G2003><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> I would <S%G2309><s%> that all <S%G3956><s%> men <S%G444><s%> were <S%G1511><s%> even as <S%G5613><s%> <S%G2532><s%> I myself. <S%G1683><s%> But <S%G235><s%> every man <S%G1538><s%> hath <S%G2192><s%> his proper <S%G2398><s%> gift <S%G5486><s%> of <S%G1537><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> one <S%G3739><s%> <S%G3303><s%> after this manner, <S%G3779><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> another <S%G3739><s%> after that. <S%G3779><s%>

I say <S%G3004><s%> therefore <S%G1161><s%> to the <S%G3588><s%> unmarried <S%G22><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> widows, <S%G5503><s%> It is <S%G2076><s%> good <S%G2570><s%> for them <S%G846><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> they abide <S%G3306><s%> even as I. <S%G2504><s%> <S%G5613><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> they cannot contain, <S%G1467><s%> <S%G3756><s%> let them marry: <S%G1060><s%> for <S%G1063><s%> it is <S%G2076><s%> better <S%G2909><s%> to marry <S%G1060><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> to burn. <S%G4448><s%>

And <S%G1161><s%> unto the <S%G3588><s%> married <S%G1060><s%> I command, <S%G3853><s%> yet not <S%G3756><s%> I, <S%G1473><s%> but <S%G235><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> Lord, <S%G2962><s%> Let not <S%G3361><s%> the wife <S%G1135><s%> depart <S%G5563><s%> from <S%G575><s%> her husband: <S%G435><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> she depart, <S%G5563><s%> let her remain <S%G3306><s%> unmarried, <S%G22><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> be reconciled <S%G2644><s%> to her husband: <S%G435><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> let not <S%G3361><s%> the husband <S%G435><s%> put away <S%G863><s%> his wife. <S%G1135><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> to the <S%G3588><s%> rest <S%G3062><s%> speak <S%G3004><s%> I, <S%G1473><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> Lord: <S%G2962><s%> If any <S%G1536><s%> brother <S%G80><s%> hath <S%G2192><s%> a wife <S%G1135><s%> that believeth not, <S%G571><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> she <S%G846><s%> be pleased <S%G4909><s%> to dwell <S%G3611><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> let him not <S%G3361><s%> put her away. <S%G863><s%> <S%G846><s%>

And <S%G2532><s%> the woman <S%G1135><s%> which <S%G3748><s%> hath <S%G2192><s%> a husband <S%G435><s%> that believeth not, <S%G571><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> if he <S%G846><s%> be pleased <S%G4909><s%> to dwell <S%G3611><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> her, <S%G846><s%> let her not <S%G3361><s%> leave <S%G863><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> unbelieving <S%G571><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> is sanctified <S%G37><s%> by <S%G1722><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> wife, <S%G1135><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> unbelieving <S%G571><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%> is sanctified <S%G37><s%> by <S%G1722><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> husband: <S%G435><s%> else <S%G1893><s%> <S%G686><s%> were <S%G2076><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> children <S%G5043><s%> unclean; <S%G169><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> now <S%G3568><s%> are <S%G2076><s%> they holy. <S%G40><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> unbelieving <S%G571><s%> depart, <S%G5563><s%> let him depart. <S%G5563><s%> A brother <S%G80><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> a sister <S%G79><s%> is not <S%G3756><s%> under bondage <S%G1402><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> cases: but <S%G1161><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> hath called <S%G2564><s%> us <S%G2248><s%> to <S%G1722><s%> peace. <S%G1515><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> knowest <S%G1492><s%> thou, O wife, <S%G1135><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> thou shalt save <S%G4982><s%> thy husband? <S%G435><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> how <S%G5101><s%> knowest <S%G1492><s%> thou, O man, <S%G435><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> thou shalt save <S%G4982><s%> thy wife? <S%G1135><s%>

But <S%G1508><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> hath distributed <S%G3307><s%> to every man, <S%G1538><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> Lord <S%G2962><s%> hath called <S%G2564><s%> every one, <S%G1538><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> let him walk. <S%G4043><s%> And <S%G2532><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> ordain <S%G1299><s%> I in <S%G1722><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> churches. <S%G1577><s%>

Is any man <S%G5100><s%> called <S%G2564><s%> being circumcised? <S%G4059><s%> let him not <S%G3361><s%> become uncircumcised. <S%G1986><s%> Is any <S%G5100><s%> called <S%G2564><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> uncircumcision? <S%G203><s%> let him not <S%G3361><s%> be circumcised. <S%G4059><s%>

Circumcision <S%G4061><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> nothing, <S%G3762><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> uncircumcision <S%G203><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> nothing, <S%G3762><s%> but <S%G235><s%> the keeping <S%G5084><s%> of the commandments <S%G1785><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
Let every man <S%G1538><s%> <S%G1722><s%> <S%G5026><s%> abide <S%G3306><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the same <S%G3588><s%> calling <S%G2821><s%> wherein <S%G3739><s%> he was called. <S%G2564><s%>

Art thou called <S%G2564><s%> being a servant? <S%G1401><s%> care <S%G3199><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> for <S%G4671><s%> it: but <S%G235><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> thou mayest <S%G1410><s%> be made <S%G1096><s%> free, <S%G1658><s%> use <S%G5530><s%> it rather. <S%G3123><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> he that is called <S%G2564><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the Lord, <S%G2962><s%> being a servant, <S%G1401><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> the Lord's <S%G2962><s%> freeman: <S%G558><s%> likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> he that is called, <S%G2564><s%> being free, <S%G1658><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> Christ's <S%G5547><s%> servant. <S%G1401><s%>
Ye are bought <S%G59><s%> with a price; <S%G5092><s%> be <S%G1096><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> ye the servants <S%G1401><s%> of men. <S%G444><s%>

Brethren, <S%G80><s%> let every man, <S%G1538><s%> wherein <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3739><s%> he is called, <S%G2564><s%> therein <S%G1722><s%> <S%G5129><s%> abide <S%G3306><s%> with <S%G3844><s%> God. <S%G2316><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> virgins <S%G3933><s%> I have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> commandment <S%G2003><s%> of the Lord: <S%G2962><s%> yet <S%G1161><s%> I give <S%G1325><s%> my judgment, <S%G1106><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> one that hath obtained mercy <S%G1653><s%> of <S%G5259><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> to be <S%G1511><s%> faithful. <S%G4103><s%>

I suppose <S%G3543><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> that this <S%G5124><s%> is <S%G5225><s%> good <S%G2570><s%> for <S%G1223><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> present <S%G1764><s%> distress, <S%G318><s%> I say, that <S%G3754><s%> it is good <S%G2570><s%> for a man <S%G444><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> to be. <S%G1511><s%>

Art thou bound <S%G1210><s%> unto a wife? <S%G1135><s%> seek <S%G2212><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> to be loosed. <S%G3080><s%> Art thou loosed <S%G3089><s%> from <S%G575><s%> a wife? <S%G1135><s%> seek <S%G2212><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> a wife. <S%G1135><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> thou marry, <S%G1060><s%> thou hast not <S%G3756><s%> sinned; <S%G264><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> a virgin <S%G3933><s%> marry, <S%G1060><s%> she hath not <S%G3756><s%> sinned. <S%G264><s%> Nevertheless <S%G1161><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> shall have <S%G2192><s%> trouble <S%G2347><s%> in the <S%G3588><s%> flesh: <S%G4561><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> spare <S%G5339><s%> you. <S%G5216><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> this <S%G5124><s%> I say, <S%G5346><s%> brethren, <S%G80><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> time <S%G2540><s%> is short: <S%G4958><s%> it remaineth, <S%G2076><s%> <S%G3063><s%> that <S%G2443><s%> both <S%G2532><s%> they that have <S%G2192><s%> wives <S%G1135><s%> be <S%G5600><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> they had <S%G2192><s%> none; <S%G3361><s%>

And <S%G2532><s%> they that weep, <S%G2799><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> they wept <S%G2799><s%> not; <S%G3361><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> they that rejoice, <S%G5463><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> they rejoiced <S%G5463><s%> not; <S%G3361><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> they that buy, <S%G59><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> they possessed <S%G2722><s%> not; <S%G3361><s%>

And <S%G2532><s%> they that use <S%G5530><s%> this <S%G5129><s%> world, <S%G2889><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> abusing <S%G2710><s%> it: for <S%G1063><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> fashion <S%G4976><s%> of this <S%G5127><s%> world <S%G2889><s%> passeth away. <S%G3855><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> I would <S%G2309><s%> have <S%G1511><s%> you <S%G5209><s%> without carefulness. <S%G275><s%> He that is unmarried <S%G22><s%> careth for <S%G3309><s%> the things <S%G3588><s%> that belong to the <S%G3588><s%> Lord, <S%G2962><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> he may please <S%G700><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> Lord: <S%G2962><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> he that is married <S%G1060><s%> careth for <S%G3309><s%> the things <S%G3588><s%> that are of the <S%G3588><s%> world, <S%G2889><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> he may please <S%G700><s%> his wife. <S%G1135><s%>

There is difference also between <S%G3307><s%> a wife <S%G1135><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> a virgin. <S%G3933><s%> The <S%G3588><s%> unmarried woman <S%G22><s%> careth for <S%G3309><s%> the things <S%G3588><s%> of the <S%G3588><s%> Lord, <S%G2962><s%> that <S%G2443><s%> she may be <S%G5600><s%> holy <S%G40><s%> both <S%G2532><s%> in body <S%G4983><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> in spirit: <S%G4151><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> she that is married <S%G1060><s%> careth for <S%G3309><s%> the things <S%G3588><s%> of the <S%G3588><s%> world, <S%G2889><s%> how <S%G4459><s%> she may please <S%G700><s%> her husband. <S%G435><s%>

And <S%G1161><s%> this <S%G5124><s%> I speak <S%G3004><s%> for <S%G4314><s%> your own <S%G5216><s%> <S%G846><s%> profit; <S%G4851><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> that <S%G2443><s%> I may cast <S%G1911><s%> a snare <S%G1029><s%> upon you, <S%G5213><s%> but <S%G235><s%> for <S%G4314><s%> that which is comely, <S%G2158><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> that ye may attend upon <S%G2145><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> Lord <S%G2962><s%> without distraction. <S%G563><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> any man <S%G5100><s%> think <S%G3543><s%> that he behaveth himself uncomely <S%G807><s%> toward <S%G1909><s%> his <S%G848><s%> virgin, <S%G3933><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> she pass the flower of her age, <S%G5600><s%> <S%G5230><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> need <S%G3784><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> require, <S%G1096><s%> let him do <S%G4160><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> he will, <S%G2309><s%> he sinneth <S%G264><s%> not: <S%G3756><s%> let them marry. <S%G1060><s%>

Nevertheless <S%G1161><s%> he <S%G3739><s%> that standeth <S%G2476><s%> steadfast <S%G1476><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> his heart, <S%G2588><s%> having <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> necessity, <S%G318><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> hath <S%G2192><s%> power <S%G1849><s%> over <S%G4012><s%> his own <S%G2398><s%> will, <S%G2307><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> hath so <S%G5124><s%> decreed <S%G2919><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> his <S%G848><s%> heart <S%G2588><s%> that he will keep <S%G5083><s%> his <S%G1438><s%> virgin, <S%G3933><s%> doeth <S%G4160><s%> well. <S%G2573><s%>

So then <S%G5620><s%> <S%G2532><s%> he that giveth her in marriage <S%G1547><s%> doeth <S%G4160><s%> well; <S%G2573><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> he that giveth her not in marriage <S%G1547><s%> <S%G3361><s%> doeth <S%G4160><s%> better. <S%G2908><s%>

The wife <S%G1135><s%> is bound <S%G1210><s%> by the law <S%G3551><s%> as long as <S%G1909><s%> <S%G3745><s%> <S%G5550><s%> her <S%G848><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> liveth; <S%G2198><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> her <S%G848><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> be dead, <S%G2837><s%> she is <S%G2076><s%> at liberty <S%G1658><s%> to be married <S%G1060><s%> to whom <S%G3739><s%> she will; <S%G2309><s%> only <S%G3440><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the Lord. <S%G2962><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> she is <S%G2076><s%> happier <S%G3107><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> she so <S%G3779><s%> abide, <S%G3306><s%> after <S%G2596><s%> my <S%G1699><s%> judgment: <S%G1106><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> I think <S%G1380><s%> also that I <S%G2504><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> the Spirit <S%G4151><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
